markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Sneaky Key](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2993)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Consumable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=564" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=644" />
<trait label="Talisman" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=709" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 267 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Price** 22 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** affixed to armor

</row>

<row gap="medium">
<row gap="tiny"><row>**Activate**</row><actions string="Single Action" /><row>([manipulate](/Traits.aspx?ID=104))</row></row>

 

 

**Requirement** You are trained in Thievery
</row>

</column>

---

This small silver skeleton key can be pinned to armor or a sleeve. When you turn the key to activate it, you gain a +1 status bonus to Thievery checks to [Pick a Lock](/Actions.aspx?ID=70) for 1 minute. The first time you get a success or critical success on an attempt to Pick a Lock, you achieve one additional success toward opening a complex lock.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
name: Sneaky Key

text: <title level="1" right="Item 5" pfs="Standard" > Sneaky Key Source GM Core pg. 267 2.0 Price 22 gp Usage affixed to armor Activate Single Action (manipulate) Requirement You are trained in Thievery --- This small silver skeleton key can be pinned to armor or a sleeve. When you turn the key to activate it, you gain a +1 status bonus to Thievery checks to Pick a Lock for 1 minute. The first time you get a success or critical success on an attempt to Pick a Lock, you achieve one additional success toward opening a complex lock.
